positive.review:
After putting in 150+ hours with FC 24, I can say this entry genuinely hooked me. The gameplay feels more responsive than recent titles, and the new animations make passes, shots, and tackles feel smoother and more realistic. It’s easy to drop in for “just one match” and suddenly realize you’ve been playing for hours.

Career Mode and Ultimate Team both have solid depth this year. Building squads, developing players, and experimenting with tactics kept things engaging way longer than I expected. Even when the game gets frustrating (as all football games do), the moment-to-moment action is fun enough to pull you right back in.

If you’re into football games, FC 24 is absolutely worth the time — clearly, I spent more than enough hours to prove it.

I mainly enjoy playing Manager Mode, and after spending 320 hours on this game, what I liked most was signing my favorite players, developing the club I love, and leading them to trophies. That whole journey and story was really fun. However, there were a few drawbacks I noticed in Manager Mode. For example, I often saw my strikers suddenly stop in front of goal instead of finishing the chance, and players frequently ignored the tactical instructions I gave them, which was frustrating at times. I was also a bit disappointed that as the years went by in-game, I couldn’t see some of the players still playing in 2025 and 2026.

Overall, I really enjoyed my time with this game, and as someone who has loved football for a long time and played Manager Mode for many years, I would give it a 7 out of 10 if 10 is a perfect score. With this, I’m saying goodbye and moving on to 26, where I’m excited to start a new Manager Mode, build a fresh squad, and create another fun journey. I’m grateful I was able to play this game for so long, and even though this is a farewell, I’m already looking forward to what’s next in 26.

EA Sports FC 24 improves a lot on the pitch. The new PlayStyles system adds real variety to players’ behaviors, and the passing and acceleration feel more controlled yet dynamic. The Career Mode gets a nice boost too: tactical vision, new coaches, and pre-match planning make managing a club more engaging. Not perfect, but definitely one of the better FC/FIFA-style entries recently.
Best fucking gameeeeeeee...first game iever bought to play and worth it
Better than FC25. The keepers won't pass to the other team and defending feels more satisfying.
The game is good although would have loved to play with more than 1 friend at a time in some online mode.
Bro its not working, the games is crash
i platyed as jeff nippard and dominated the mls

Really fun and enjoyable. It’s simple, smooth, and entertaining, with great gameplay and good vibes all around. Addictive and satisfying, I keep coming back for more. Overall, a solid game that’s fun, relaxing, and has just the right amount of challenge.

EA Sports FC 24 improves a lot on the pitch. The new PlayStyles system adds real variety to players’ behaviors, and the passing and acceleration feel more controlled yet dynamic. The Career Mode gets a nice boost too: tactical vision, new coaches, and pre-match planning make managing a club more engaging. Not perfect, but definitely one of the better FC/FIFA-style entries recently.

I’ve been playing FIFA 24 for over 1.5 years now, and I have to say the experience just keeps getting better. FIFA 24 feels smoother, and really fun to play, whether it’s quick matches or longer career sessions. I enjoy spending my free time on it, and it never feels repetitive. The updated graphics, improved gameplay mechanics. Ultimate Team and Career Mode are still engaging, and the little tweaks in controls make a big difference.

Overall, FIFA 24 is a solid step forward for both casual players and long-time fans like me. It keeps the spirit of the series alive while adding enough freshness to make it worth playing regularly.
Nice game compared to the newer garbage that EA is releasing. Actually feels like a football game

I guess having played previous versions of fifa i had a little bias towards the older versions like fifa 14, 17, etc but nonetheless found the game to be fun. this fc brand is not really an improvement on the older versions, be it the gameplay or the player mechanics, just too many glitches.
so good. always good. was never bad, played all day, when i came from school i just skipped my lunch and played this game all day

Получается шизофренический опыт: на одном экране — шедевр футбольного симулятора с тактической глубиной, на другом — жесткий кард-коллектор, который выжимает из тебя все соки. Рекомендовать можно только тем, у кого стальные нервы и готовность закрывать глаза на откровенно жадную монетизацию. Игра-раздвоение личности: вы либо возненавидите её, либо попадёте в зависимость.

This will be the first time I'm ever writing a Steam review. EA Sports FC or FIFA as it was once known, has a long history. Regardless of what some others might say, I feel as if the gameplay has improved to a point where it's base level is perfectly good. It has enough control for you to feel as though you're having an effect on the game, but it's invariables and physics are dynamic enough for unpredictable things to happen. It genuinely feels good to play.

Unfortunately, despite all of this, Electronic Arts continue their tradition of being as hostile as they possibly can towards the people who actually purchase their games. The PC version isn't only poorly optimised, but forces you to install an additional EA program on your computer, which will automatically start when you run the game on Steam. EA Sports FC will then go through a routine comprised of making sure your version of the game is legitimate and constantly trying to connect you to the internet. This whole thing makes loading the game up an unenjoyable experience.

Sometimes the game won't start at all. Sometimes it will start but freeze trying to connect you to the internet. Sometimes you will encounter a splash screen within the load-up trying to up-sell you to their newest version of the game. This is often all done with you fighting the noticeable lag on the menus. If you manage to get through all of that, you may encounter a “double controller” glitch which makes you unable to progress to actually play a game. 

This is also all happening under the hood of EA unnecessarily releasing a game every year. Every year, each version of the game becomes redundant. What was once a single-player game continues to have features stripped away in aid of trying to force it's players to interact with it's online market and gambling.

All of this is to say that the game itself is fun. It is enjoyable. It's football. It should be simple. But ultimately, it's about whether you want to pay for a game made by such an anti-consumer company like EA.

If you ever feel the callback to play This FC, I shall share my experience. 
2 days ago, working perfectly normal, now FC26 is out, its like watching a porno and not getting to finish because of overwhelming shame.
That is the feeling that a Game that is 2 years old, cant seem to find the 4070 in my laptop pc that even assassin's creed shadows can find, a much more demanding game on every level. EA now reminds me of a prostitute that cannot get you to finish but still expects you to pay with either your wallet or a swift kick to the balls.
Literally unplayable because EA's draconian anti-cheat finds conflicts with harmless programs and drivers.
the game just stopped working on my face one day out of nowhere. been working on trying to fix it since then
